intro: Sisyrinchium montanum subsp. crebrum, commonly known as the mountain blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Sisyrinchium montanum subsp. crebrum is a low-growing plant that reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters.
